utterances: Boss, I really believe that I deserve a raise. I've been working hard and exceeding my targets for the past few months.
Can you tell me why that is? Is there anything I can do to change your mind?
I understand the situation, but I feel like my efforts have been overlooked. Is there any way you could consider a raise in the future?
Thank you for being transparent with me. I'll make sure to keep working hard and we can revisit this conversation in the future.
I'll keep that in mind, thank you.
Boss, I'm not feeling well today. I scratched myself yesterday and now I have an itchy rash.
Not yet, but I think I should. I can't focus on work with this constant itching.
I think I can manage, but I may have to leave early if it gets worse.
Ah, yes. I remember that. I was hoping we could revisit that because I feel like I've been performing really well.
I see. Is there any way we can come to a compromise? Maybe a smaller raise or some additional benefits?
Alright, I understand. Thanks for considering it. And thanks for being understanding about my health situation today.
Good morning, Boss. I hope you're doing well. Can we talk about my salary?
I've been working really hard and I think I deserve a raise.
I see. But I've been taking on extra responsibilities and putting in more hours. I think I deserve to be compensated for my hard work.
I understand. But I don't think it's fair that I'm not being paid what I'm worth. Is there anything else we can do to find a compromise?
I appreciate your willingness to consider other options, but I really need the extra income. Can we revisit this conversation in a few months when the budget is less tight?
Thank you, Boss. I appreciate your time.
Good morning, Boss. I hope you are doing well. Can I talk to you about my health?
I scratched myself a few days ago, and now I have a rash that's causing me a lot of discomfort. I think I need to see a doctor.
Thank you, Boss. I appreciate your concern.
Good morning, Boss. I hope all is well. Can I speak to you about a personal matter?

I was walking to the store yesterday when I stepped on a sharp rock and injured my foot. I had to limp home and ask my mom to take me to the doctor. I may need to take a day or two off to rest and recover.
